phrases.usage: Use this when you need to identify the specific transport service for a destination because multiple routes operate from the station.
phrases.example: Which bus goes to the airport because I must catch my flight on time?

phrases.usage: Request this information to locate the specific boarding area so you can wait in the correct position.
phrases.example: Which platform is it for the express service so I can find the correct boarding gate?

phrases.usage: Inquire about the immediate departure schedule to determine if you have enough time to prepare.
phrases.example: When is the next one because I would like to purchase a bottle of water first?

phrases.usage: Ask this to assess the reliability of the schedule so you can plan your arrival accordingly.
phrases.example: Is it usually on time in the morning because I have a strict appointment to attend?

phrases.usage: Determine the duration of the journey to calculate your total travel time.
phrases.example: How long is the ride to the airport so I can notify my colleague of my arrival time?

phrases.text: Just to confirm, it’s bus ... from platform ...?
phrases.usage: Verify the information provided by the attendant to ensure you do not miss your departure.
phrases.example: Just to confirm, it’s bus 7 from platform 3 so I can be sure I am in the right place?

keyVocabulary.definition: A designated area where passengers wait to board a specific bus or train.
The action of leaving a place or the scheduled time when a vehicle starts its journey.
The final place to which a person or vehicle is traveling.
A formal plan that lists the times when arrivals and departures are supposed to happen.
A specific path or direction between places that a vehicle follows regularly.
